qas.question: Who was the British ambassador in 1853?
Who declared they no longer wanted to spread Imperial Russian?
Who did the Tsar send on a mission to Ottoman Sublime Porte?
In what year was Prince Menshikov sent to the Ottoman Sublime Porte?
Who wanted to ruled over the 12 million Orthodox Christians in the Empire?

context: Nicholas began courting Britain by means of conversations with the British ambassador, <a0_0>George Hamilton Seymour<a0_0/>, in January and February 1853.:105 <a1_0>Nicholas<a1_0/> insisted that he no longer wished to expand Imperial Russia:105 but that he had an obligation to the Christian communities in the Ottoman Empire.:105  The Tsar next dispatched a highly abrasive diplomat, <a2_0>Prince Menshikov<a2_0/>, on a special mission to the Ottoman Sublime Porte in February <a3_0>1853<a3_0/>. By previous treaties, the sultan was committed "to protect the (Eastern Orthodox) Christian religion and its churches." <a4_0>Menshikov<a4_0/> demanded a Russian protectorate over all 12 million Orthodox Christians in the Empire, with control of the Orthodox Church's hierarchy. A compromise was reached regarding Orthodox access to the Holy Land, but the Sultan, strongly supported by the British ambassador, rejected the more sweeping demands.
